data.title: Good Food, Great Value!!!
data.text: I've driven by this place several times before and decided to try it for lunch today.  I looks appealing form the outside and the interior is nice but not overly fancy.  They have a lunch special and I decided to try the Kung Pao chicken.  The lunch special comes with a cup of either hot and sour soup or egg drop soup, a choice of appetizer, and the entree. The hot and sour soup was quite tasty, perhaps a little spicier than most places.  The egg roll was small but good and the kung pao chicken was excellent.  Lots of large pieces of chicken in a savory sauce servedwith a side of ham-fried rice.  With a soft drink the total cost was $8.89.  My waiter was quick and quite attentive.  Definitely recommend and I will be back with my wife.

data.title: Decent Chinese at a good price.
data.text: We usually go here for lunch when we can eat for $7 a person with their lunch specials. This is a family owned restaurant and we go their enough that they know us and treat us very kindly. It's not the best Chinese food but it is good. Besides, England is a long way to go for my favorite Chinese food. I would rate this among the top of my favorite Chinese restaurants.

data.title: Should have gone to Panda Express....
data.text: I am from Seattle and we stopped here for lunch based on the 4 stars. It was the nastiest food I have had in a long time. I couldn't even finish the Mongolian Beef. It was just rubbery and tasteless and covered with a clear gloopy sauce. The ham fried rice was just rice with a little soy sauce and cubes of ham - nothing fancy or tasty - although it was the best part.  My companion had sweet and sour chicken which was just Katsu cut in strips with one chunk of green pepper, one chunk of carrot and a small chunk of pineapple. She wanted a knife because the pepper chunk was too big to shove in her mouth but the waiter just sped by calling out, "Everything Okay?" and we didn't want to chase him around the place. Hers was better than mine, though.  We drove past the place 3 times in the next 2 days doing errands and shouted "Boo!  Hiss!" every time we did.  I don't get how this is highly rated.  Do people in Utah REALLY not know what decent food tastes like?

data.title: Was really skeptical going in as the previous restaurant in that space the owner was just horrible!
data.text: Good was hood, service wick and friendly. Definitely worth the try!   Don't be afraid it is related to the previous restaurant, thAt lady scared everyone away!

data.title: Good spot for takeout
data.text: We ordered takeout:  Walnut Shrimp, Sizzling Seafood Delight, Peking Beef, General Tso's Chicken, and Hot and Sour Soup.  All the food was consistently good.  As we are new to the area, we sought the recommendation of a few neighbors for a good Chinese restaurant.  This place did not disappoint.   Next time we'll probably eat in-house.

data.title: Great food, Awesome service!
data.text: The Red Dragon was fantastic. We loved the food, and the service was equally impressive. I had the Walnut Shrimp which was comparable to Asian Star's same platter. Not busy, even on a Friday night. We enjoy Pei Wei, but it is always so crowded and loud. You will enjoy Red Dragon.

data.title: Newly remodeled gem
data.text: We have been there a couple of times and the food was great the prices were reasonable and the service was excellent. This authentic Chinese restaurant is a must try.

data.title: If you like spicy food...
data.text: This is one of the few Chinese restaurants in the area which claims to have Szechwan food which actually does.  Not everything is spicy, but everything is more authentic than most of the Americanized Chinese food that you get in this area.
